main event: A bright orange object was observed visually and on ground radar near Moisant, LA.
interesting points: The object was about 15 feet in diameter and estimated to be moving at 6,000 mph., The sighting lasted a total of 5 minutes., The object was described as having a straight course., Both visual and radar data were collected during the observation., The conclusion suggested the sighting could be a meteor.
witness description: two observers who confirmed it was not the moon and described it as a streak of light
